title: Who is 'Ronnie' in the song Take Me Home Tonight? - Quora

response.answer_text: Ronnie Spector - was once the lead singer of the Ronettes and wife of the notorious Phil Spector. Phil was once a flamboyant music producer with wild hair dos and wigs, and produced a number of hits with the Ronnettes. They were married for 6 years during which time he held her a virtual prisoner in his mansion. Phil slipped further into depression as his career floundered and was diagnosed as schizophrenic bipolar. He was later found guilty of the second degree murder of Lana Clarkson which occurred in the foyer of the mansion. Ronnie can be heard singing in the background of Eddie Money’s hit, Take Me Home Tonight. Eddie sings, “just like Ronnie said”, and then you can hear Ronnie sing “be my little baby “.

Ronnie in the song “Take Me Home Tonight” refers to Ronnie Spector (aka Veronica Bennett), former lead vocalist of the 60s all-girl singing group The Ronettes. One of the group’s songs, “Be My Baby” had a portion that was re-recorded in Eddie Money’s “Take Me Home Tonight” with Ronnie singing that particular part.
